revised_title: Magnetic Experiments on Iron Steam-Vessels and Compass Deviation
tldr: The author conducted magnetic experiments on an iron steam-vessel to investigate the effects of its iron structure on the compass. The results showed that the magnetic influence of the iron caused deviations in the compass, and the author provided recommendations for placing the steering compass in iron steam-vessels to minimize these effects. The study also compared the effects of local attraction on different steam-boats.
